revised_title: Answering Objections to the Geometrical Representation of Square Roots of Negative Quantities
tldr: The author, John Warren, addresses objections raised against the geometrical representation of square roots of negative quantities. He argues that these quantities, though sometimes considered 'impossible,' can be real and significant in certain cases. Warren also establishes a necessary connection between algebra and geometry, and suggests that a true theory of negative and imaginary quantities will be useful in solving dynamics problems within a single plane.
